18#include <sys/cdefs.h>
19__RCSID("$NetBSD: tpool.c,v 1.1.1.6 2018/02/06 01:53:08 christos Exp $");
20
21#include "portable.h"
22
23#include <stdio.h>
24
25#include <ac/signal.h>
26#include <ac/stdarg.h>
27#include <ac/stdlib.h>
28#include <ac/string.h>
29#include <ac/time.h>
30#include <ac/errno.h>
31
32#include "ldap-int.h"
33#include "ldap_pvt_thread.h" /* Get the thread interface */
34#include "ldap_queue.h"
35#define LDAP_THREAD_POOL_IMPLEMENTATION
36#include "ldap_thr_debug.h" /* May rename symbols defined below */
37
38#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_TPOOL
39
40/* Thread-specific key with data and optional free function */
41typedef struct ldap_int_tpool_key_s {
42 void *ltk_key;
43 void *ltk_data;
44 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_keyfree_t *ltk_free;
45} ldap_int_tpool_key_t;
46
47/* Max number of thread-specific keys we store per thread.
48 * We don't expect to use many...
49 */
50#define MAXKEYS 32
51
52/* Max number of threads */
53#define LDAP_MAXTHR 1024 /* must be a power of 2 */
54
55/* (Theoretical) max number of pending requests */
56#define MAX_PENDING (INT_MAX/2) /* INT_MAX - (room to avoid overflow) */
57
58/* pool->ltp_pause values */
59enum { NOT_PAUSED = 0, WANT_PAUSE = 1, PAUSED = 2 };
60
61/* Context: thread ID and thread-specific key/data pairs */
62typedef struct ldap_int_thread_userctx_s {
63 ldap_pvt_thread_t ltu_id;
64 ldap_int_tpool_key_t ltu_key[MAXKEYS];
65} ldap_int_thread_userctx_t;
66
67
68/* Simple {thread ID -> context} hash table; key=ctx->ltu_id.
69 * Protected by ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex except during pauses,
70 * when it is read-only (used by pool_purgekey and pool_context).
71 * Protected by tpool->ltp_mutex during pauses.
72 */
73static struct {
74 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx;
75 /* ctx is valid when not NULL or DELETED_THREAD_CTX */
76# define DELETED_THREAD_CTX (&ldap_int_main_thrctx + 1) /* dummy addr */
77} thread_keys[LDAP_MAXTHR];
78
79#define TID_HASH(tid, hash) do { \
80 unsigned const char *ptr_ = (unsigned const char *)&(tid); \
81 unsigned i_; \
82 for (i_ = 0, (hash) = ptr_[0]; ++i_ < sizeof(tid);) \
83 (hash) += ((hash) << 5) ^ ptr_[i_]; \
84} while(0)
85
86
87/* Task for a thread to perform */
88typedef struct ldap_int_thread_task_s {
89 union {
90 LDAP_STAILQ_ENTRY(ldap_int_thread_task_s) q;
91 LDAP_SLIST_ENTRY(ldap_int_thread_task_s) l;
92 } ltt_next;
93 ldap_pvt_thread_start_t *ltt_start_routine;
94 void *ltt_arg;
95} ldap_int_thread_task_t;
96
97typedef LDAP_STAILQ_HEAD(tcq, ldap_int_thread_task_s) ldap_int_tpool_plist_t;
98
99struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s {
100 LDAP_STAILQ_ENTRY(ldap_int_thread_pool_s) ltp_next;
101
102 /* protect members below, and protect thread_keys[] during pauses */
103 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t ltp_mutex;
104
105 /* not paused and something to do for pool_<wrapper/pause/destroy>() */
106 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t ltp_cond;
107
108 /* ltp_active_count <= 1 && ltp_pause */
109 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t ltp_pcond;
110
111 /* ltp_pause == 0 ? &ltp_pending_list : &empty_pending_list,
112 * maintaned to reduce work for pool_wrapper()
113 */
114 ldap_int_tpool_plist_t *ltp_work_list;
115
116 /* pending tasks, and unused task objects */
117 ldap_int_tpool_plist_t ltp_pending_list;
118 LDAP_SLIST_HEAD(tcl, ldap_int_thread_task_s) ltp_free_list;
119
120 /* The pool is finishing, waiting for its threads to close.
121 * They close when ltp_pending_list is done. pool_submit()
122 * rejects new tasks. ltp_max_pending = -(its old value).
123 */
124 int ltp_finishing;
125
126 /* Some active task needs to be the sole active task.
127 * Atomic variable so ldap_pvt_thread_pool_pausing() can read it.
128 * Note: Pauses adjust ltp_<open_count/vary_open_count/work_list>,
129 * so pool_<submit/wrapper>() mostly can avoid testing ltp_pause.
130 */
131 volatile sig_atomic_t ltp_pause;
132
133 /* Max number of threads in pool, or 0 for default (LDAP_MAXTHR) */
134 int ltp_max_count;
135
136 /* Max pending + paused + idle tasks, negated when ltp_finishing */
137 int ltp_max_pending;
138
139 int ltp_pending_count; /* Pending + paused + idle tasks */
140 int ltp_active_count; /* Active, not paused/idle tasks */
141 int ltp_open_count; /* Number of threads, negated when ltp_pause */
142 int ltp_starting; /* Currenlty starting threads */
143
144 /* >0 if paused or we may open a thread, <0 if we should close a thread.
145 * Updated when ltp_<finishing/pause/max_count/open_count> change.
146 * Maintained to reduce the time ltp_mutex must be locked in
147 * ldap_pvt_thread_pool_<submit/wrapper>().
148 */
149 int ltp_vary_open_count;
150# define SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool) \
151 ((pool)->ltp_vary_open_count = \
152 (pool)->ltp_pause ? 1 : \
153 (pool)->ltp_finishing ? -1 : \
154 ((pool)->ltp_max_count ? (pool)->ltp_max_count : LDAP_MAXTHR) \
155 - (pool)->ltp_open_count)
156};
157
158static ldap_int_tpool_plist_t empty_pending_list =
159 LDAP_STAILQ_HEAD_INITIALIZER(empty_pending_list);
160
161static int ldap_int_has_thread_pool = 0;
162static LDAP_STAILQ_HEAD(tpq, ldap_int_thread_pool_s)
163 ldap_int_thread_pool_list =
164 LDAP_STAILQ_HEAD_INITIALIZER(ldap_int_thread_pool_list);
165
166static ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex;
167
168static void *ldap_int_thread_pool_wrapper( void *pool );
169
170static ldap_pvt_thread_key_t ldap_tpool_key;
171
172/* Context of the main thread */
173static ldap_int_thread_userctx_t ldap_int_main_thrctx;
174
175int
176ldap_int_thread_pool_startup ( void )
177{
178 ldap_int_main_thrctx.ltu_id = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
179 ldap_pvt_thread_key_create( &ldap_tpool_key );
180 return ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
181}
182
183int
184ldap_int_thread_pool_shutdown ( void )
185{
186 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
187
188 while ((pool = LDAP_STAILQ_FIRST(&ldap_int_thread_pool_list)) != NULL) {
189 (ldap_pvt_thread_pool_destroy)(&pool, 0); /* ignore thr_debug macro */
190 }
191 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
192 ldap_pvt_thread_key_destroy( ldap_tpool_key );
193 return(0);
194}
195
196
197/* Create a thread pool */
198int
199ldap_pvt_thread_pool_init (
200 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool,
201 int max_threads,
202 int max_pending )
203{
204 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t pool;
205 int rc;
206
207 /* multiple pools are currently not supported (ITS#4943) */
208 assert(!ldap_int_has_thread_pool);
209
210 if (! (0 <= max_threads && max_threads <= LDAP_MAXTHR))
211 max_threads = 0;
212 if (! (1 <= max_pending && max_pending <= MAX_PENDING))
213 max_pending = MAX_PENDING;
214
215 *tpool = NULL;
216 pool = (ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t) LDAP_CALLOC(1,
217 sizeof(struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s));
218
219 if (pool == NULL) return(-1);
220
221 rc = ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init(&pool->ltp_mutex);
222 if (rc != 0) {
223fail1:
224 LDAP_FREE(pool);
225 return(rc);
226 }
227 rc = ldap_pvt_thread_cond_init(&pool->ltp_cond);
228 if (rc != 0) {
229fail2:
230 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy(&pool->ltp_mutex);
231 goto fail1;
232 }
233 rc = ldap_pvt_thread_cond_init(&pool->ltp_pcond);
234 if (rc != 0) {
235 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_destroy(&pool->ltp_cond);
236 goto fail2;
237 }
238
239 ldap_int_has_thread_pool = 1;
240
241 pool->ltp_max_count = max_threads;
242 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
243 pool->ltp_max_pending = max_pending;
244
245 LDAP_STAILQ_INIT(&pool->ltp_pending_list);
246 pool->ltp_work_list = &pool->ltp_pending_list;
247 LDAP_SLIST_INIT(&pool->ltp_free_list);
248
249 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
250 LDAP_STAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&ldap_int_thread_pool_list, pool, ltp_next);
251 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
252
253 /* Start no threads just yet. That can break if the process forks
254 * later, as slapd does in order to daemonize. On at least POSIX,
255 * only the forking thread would survive in the child. Yet fork()
256 * can't unlock/clean up other threads' locks and data structures,
257 * unless pthread_atfork() handlers have been set up to do so.
258 */
259
260 *tpool = pool;
261 return(0);
262}
263
264
265/* Submit a task to be performed by the thread pool */
266int
267ldap_pvt_thread_pool_submit (
268 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool,
269 ldap_pvt_thread_start_t *start_routine, void *arg )
270{
271 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
272 ldap_int_thread_task_t *task;
273 ldap_pvt_thread_t thr;
274
275 if (tpool == NULL)
276 return(-1);
277
278 pool = *tpool;
279
280 if (pool == NULL)
281 return(-1);
282
283 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
284
285 if (pool->ltp_pending_count >= pool->ltp_max_pending)
286 goto failed;
287
288 task = LDAP_SLIST_FIRST(&pool->ltp_free_list);
289 if (task) {
290 LDAP_SLIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&pool->ltp_free_list, ltt_next.l);
291 } else {
292 task = (ldap_int_thread_task_t *) LDAP_MALLOC(sizeof(*task));
293 if (task == NULL)
294 goto failed;
295 }
296
297 task->ltt_start_routine = start_routine;
298 task->ltt_arg = arg;
299
300 pool->ltp_pending_count++;
301 LDAP_STAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&pool->ltp_pending_list, task, ltt_next.q);
302
303 /* true if ltp_pause != 0 or we should open (create) a thread */
304 if (pool->ltp_vary_open_count > 0 &&
305 pool->ltp_open_count < pool->ltp_active_count+pool->ltp_pending_count)
306 {
307 if (pool->ltp_pause)
308 goto done;
309
310 pool->ltp_starting++;
311 pool->ltp_open_count++;
312 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
313
314 if (0 != ldap_pvt_thread_create(
315 &thr, 1, ldap_int_thread_pool_wrapper, pool))
316 {
317 /* couldn't create thread. back out of
318 * ltp_open_count and check for even worse things.
319 */
320 pool->ltp_starting--;
321 pool->ltp_open_count--;
322 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
323
324 if (pool->ltp_open_count == 0) {
325 /* no open threads at all?!?
326 */
327 ldap_int_thread_task_t *ptr;
328
329 /* let pool_destroy know there are no more threads */
330 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal(&pool->ltp_cond);
331
332 LDAP_STAILQ_FOREACH(ptr, &pool->ltp_pending_list, ltt_next.q)
333 if (ptr == task) break;
334 if (ptr == task) {
335 /* no open threads, task not handled, so
336 * back out of ltp_pending_count, free the task,
337 * report the error.
338 */
339 pool->ltp_pending_count--;
340 LDAP_STAILQ_REMOVE(&pool->ltp_pending_list, task,
341 ldap_int_thread_task_s, ltt_next.q);
342 LDAP_SLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&pool->ltp_free_list, task,
343 ltt_next.l);
344 goto failed;
345 }
346 }
347 /* there is another open thread, so this
348 * task will be handled eventually.
349 */
350 }
351 }
352 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal(&pool->ltp_cond);
353
354 done:
355 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
356 return(0);
357
358 failed:
359 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
360 return(-1);
361}
362
363static void *
364no_task( void *ctx, void *arg )
365{
366 return NULL;
367}
368
369/* Cancel a pending task that was previously submitted.
370 * Return 1 if the task was successfully cancelled, 0 if
371 * not found, -1 for invalid parameters
372 */
373int
374ldap_pvt_thread_pool_retract (
375 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool,
376 ldap_pvt_thread_start_t *start_routine, void *arg )
377{
378 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
379 ldap_int_thread_task_t *task;
380
381 if (tpool == NULL)
382 return(-1);
383
384 pool = *tpool;
385
386 if (pool == NULL)
387 return(-1);
388
389 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
390 LDAP_STAILQ_FOREACH(task, &pool->ltp_pending_list, ltt_next.q)
391 if (task->ltt_start_routine == start_routine &&
392 task->ltt_arg == arg) {
393 /* Could LDAP_STAILQ_REMOVE the task, but that
394 * walks ltp_pending_list again to find it.
395 */
396 task->ltt_start_routine = no_task;
397 task->ltt_arg = NULL;
398 break;
399 }
400 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
401 return task != NULL;
402}
403
404/* Set max #threads. value <= 0 means max supported #threads (LDAP_MAXTHR) */
405int
406ldap_pvt_thread_pool_maxthreads(
407 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool,
408 int max_threads )
409{
410 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
411
412 if (! (0 <= max_threads && max_threads <= LDAP_MAXTHR))
413 max_threads = 0;
414
415 if (tpool == NULL)
416 return(-1);
417
418 pool = *tpool;
419
420 if (pool == NULL)
421 return(-1);
422
423 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
424
425 pool->ltp_max_count = max_threads;
426 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
427
428 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
429 return(0);
430}
431
432/* Inspect the pool */
433int
434ldap_pvt_thread_pool_query(
435 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool,
436 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_param_t param,
437 void *value )
438{
439 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
440 int count = -1;
441
442 if ( tpool == NULL || value == NULL ) {
443 return -1;
444 }
445
446 pool = *tpool;
447
448 if ( pool == NULL ) {
449 return 0;
450 }
451
452 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
453 switch ( param ) {
454 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_MAX:
455 count = pool->ltp_max_count;
456 break;
457
458 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_MAX_PENDING:
459 count = pool->ltp_max_pending;
460 if (count < 0)
461 count = -count;
462 if (count == MAX_PENDING)
463 count = 0;
464 break;
465
466 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_OPEN:
467 count = pool->ltp_open_count;
468 if (count < 0)
469 count = -count;
470 break;
471
472 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_STARTING:
473 count = pool->ltp_starting;
474 break;
475
476 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_ACTIVE:
477 count = pool->ltp_active_count;
478 break;
479
480 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_PAUSING:
481 count = (pool->ltp_pause != 0);
482 break;
483
484 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_PENDING:
485 count = pool->ltp_pending_count;
486 break;
487
488 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_BACKLOAD:
489 count = pool->ltp_pending_count + pool->ltp_active_count;
490 break;
491
492 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_ACTIVE_MAX:
493 break;
494
495 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_PENDING_MAX:
496 break;
497
498 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_BACKLOAD_MAX:
499 break;
500
501 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_STATE:
502 *((char **)value) =
503 pool->ltp_pause ? "pausing" :
504 !pool->ltp_finishing ? "running" :
505 pool->ltp_pending_count ? "finishing" : "stopping";
506 break;
507
508 case LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_UNKNOWN:
509 break;
510 }
511 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &pool->ltp_mutex );
512
513 if ( count > -1 ) {
514 *((int *)value) = count;
515 }
516
517 return ( count == -1 ? -1 : 0 );
518}
519
520/*
521 * true if pool is pausing; does not lock any mutex to check.
522 * 0 if not pause, 1 if pause, -1 if error or no pool.
523 */
524int
525ldap_pvt_thread_pool_pausing( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
526{
527 int rc = -1;
528 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
529
530 if ( tpool != NULL && (pool = *tpool) != NULL ) {
531 rc = (pool->ltp_pause != 0);
532 }
533
534 return rc;
535}
536
537/*
538 * wrapper for ldap_pvt_thread_pool_query(), left around
539 * for backwards compatibility
540 */
541int
542ldap_pvt_thread_pool_backload ( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
543{
544 int rc, count;
545
546 rc = ldap_pvt_thread_pool_query( tpool,
547 LDAP_PVT_THREAD_POOL_PARAM_BACKLOAD, (void *)&count );
548
549 if ( rc == 0 ) {
550 return count;
551 }
552
553 return rc;
554}
555
556/* Destroy the pool after making its threads finish */
557int
558ldap_pvt_thread_pool_destroy ( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool, int run_pending )
559{
560 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool, *pptr;
561 ldap_int_thread_task_t *task;
562
563 if (tpool == NULL)
564 return(-1);
565
566 pool = *tpool;
567
568 if (pool == NULL) return(-1);
569
570 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
571 LDAP_STAILQ_FOREACH(pptr, &ldap_int_thread_pool_list, ltp_next)
572 if (pptr == pool) break;
573 if (pptr == pool)
574 LDAP_STAILQ_REMOVE(&ldap_int_thread_pool_list, pool,
575 ldap_int_thread_pool_s, ltp_next);
576 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
577
578 if (pool != pptr) return(-1);
579
580 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
581
582 pool->ltp_finishing = 1;
583 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
584 if (pool->ltp_max_pending > 0)
585 pool->ltp_max_pending = -pool->ltp_max_pending;
586
587 if (!run_pending) {
588 while ((task = LDAP_STAILQ_FIRST(&pool->ltp_pending_list)) != NULL) {
589 LDAP_STAILQ_REMOVE_HEAD(&pool->ltp_pending_list, ltt_next.q);
590 LDAP_FREE(task);
591 }
592 pool->ltp_pending_count = 0;
593 }
594
595 while (pool->ltp_open_count) {
596 if (!pool->ltp_pause)
597 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_broadcast(&pool->ltp_cond);
598 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(&pool->ltp_cond, &pool->ltp_mutex);
599 }
600
601 while ((task = LDAP_SLIST_FIRST(&pool->ltp_free_list)) != NULL)
602 {
603 LDAP_SLIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&pool->ltp_free_list, ltt_next.l);
604 LDAP_FREE(task);
605 }
606
607 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
608 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_destroy(&pool->ltp_pcond);
609 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_destroy(&pool->ltp_cond);
610 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy(&pool->ltp_mutex);
611 LDAP_FREE(pool);
612 *tpool = NULL;
613 ldap_int_has_thread_pool = 0;
614 return(0);
615}
616
617/* Thread loop. Accept and handle submitted tasks. */
618static void *
619ldap_int_thread_pool_wrapper (
620 void *xpool )
621{
622 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool = xpool;
623 ldap_int_thread_task_t *task;
624 ldap_int_tpool_plist_t *work_list;
625 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t ctx, *kctx;
626 unsigned i, keyslot, hash;
627
628 assert(pool != NULL);
629
630 for ( i=0; i<MAXKEYS; i++ ) {
631 ctx.ltu_key[i].ltk_key = NULL;
632 }
633
634 ctx.ltu_id = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
635 TID_HASH(ctx.ltu_id, hash);
636
637 ldap_pvt_thread_key_setdata( ldap_tpool_key, &ctx );
638
639 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
640
641 /* thread_keys[] is read-only when paused */
642 while (pool->ltp_pause)
643 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(&pool->ltp_cond, &pool->ltp_mutex);
644
645 /* find a key slot to give this thread ID and store a
646 * pointer to our keys there; start at the thread ID
647 * itself (mod LDAP_MAXTHR) and look for an empty slot.
648 */
649 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
650 for (keyslot = hash & (LDAP_MAXTHR-1);
651 (kctx = thread_keys[keyslot].ctx) && kctx != DELETED_THREAD_CTX;
652 keyslot = (keyslot+1) & (LDAP_MAXTHR-1));
653 thread_keys[keyslot].ctx = &ctx;
654 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
655
656 pool->ltp_starting--;
657 pool->ltp_active_count++;
658
659 for (;;) {
660 work_list = pool->ltp_work_list; /* help the compiler a bit */
661 task = LDAP_STAILQ_FIRST(work_list);
662 if (task == NULL) { /* paused or no pending tasks */
663 if (--(pool->ltp_active_count) < 2) {
664 /* Notify pool_pause it is the sole active thread. */
665 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal(&pool->ltp_pcond);
666 }
667
668 do {
669 if (pool->ltp_vary_open_count < 0) {
670 /* Not paused, and either finishing or too many
671 * threads running (can happen if ltp_max_count
672 * was reduced). Let this thread die.
673 */
674 goto done;
675 }
676
677 /* We could check an idle timer here, and let the
678 * thread die if it has been inactive for a while.
679 * Only die if there are other open threads (i.e.,
680 * always have at least one thread open).
681 * The check should be like this:
682 * if (pool->ltp_open_count>1 && pool->ltp_starting==0)
683 * check timer, wait if ltp_pause, leave thread;
684 *
685 * Just use pthread_cond_timedwait() if we want to
686 * check idle time.
687 */
688 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(&pool->ltp_cond, &pool->ltp_mutex);
689
690 work_list = pool->ltp_work_list;
691 task = LDAP_STAILQ_FIRST(work_list);
692 } while (task == NULL);
693
694 pool->ltp_active_count++;
695 }
696
697 LDAP_STAILQ_REMOVE_HEAD(work_list, ltt_next.q);
698 pool->ltp_pending_count--;
699 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
700
701 task->ltt_start_routine(&ctx, task->ltt_arg);
702
703 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
704 LDAP_SLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&pool->ltp_free_list, task, ltt_next.l);
705 }
706 done:
707
708 assert(!pool->ltp_pause); /* thread_keys writable, ltp_open_count >= 0 */
709
710 /* The ltp_mutex lock protects ctx->ltu_key from pool_purgekey()
711 * during this call, since it prevents new pauses. */
712 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_context_reset(&ctx);
713
714 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
715 thread_keys[keyslot].ctx = DELETED_THREAD_CTX;
716 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&ldap_pvt_thread_pool_mutex);
717
718 pool->ltp_open_count--;
719 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
720 /* let pool_destroy know we're all done */
721 if (pool->ltp_open_count == 0)
722 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal(&pool->ltp_cond);
723
724 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
725
726 ldap_pvt_thread_exit(NULL);
727 return(NULL);
728}
729
730/* Arguments > ltp_pause to handle_pause(,PAUSE_ARG()). arg=PAUSE_ARG
731 * ensures (arg-ltp_pause) sets GO_* at need and keeps DO_PAUSE/GO_*.
732 */
733#define GO_IDLE 8
734#define GO_UNIDLE 16
735#define CHECK_PAUSE 32 /* if ltp_pause: GO_IDLE; wait; GO_UNIDLE */
736#define DO_PAUSE 64 /* CHECK_PAUSE; pause the pool */
737#define PAUSE_ARG(a) \
738 ((a) | ((a) & (GO_IDLE|GO_UNIDLE) ? GO_IDLE-1 : CHECK_PAUSE))
739
740static int
741handle_pause( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool, int pause_type )
742{
743 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
744 int ret = 0, pause, max_ltp_pause;
745
746 if (tpool == NULL)
747 return(-1);
748
749 pool = *tpool;
750
751 if (pool == NULL)
752 return(0);
753
754 if (pause_type == CHECK_PAUSE && !pool->ltp_pause)
755 return(0);
756
757 /* Let pool_unidle() ignore requests for new pauses */
758 max_ltp_pause = pause_type==PAUSE_ARG(GO_UNIDLE) ? WANT_PAUSE : NOT_PAUSED;
759
760 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
761
762 pause = pool->ltp_pause; /* NOT_PAUSED, WANT_PAUSE or PAUSED */
763
764 /* If ltp_pause and not GO_IDLE|GO_UNIDLE: Set GO_IDLE,GO_UNIDLE */
765 pause_type -= pause;
766
767 if (pause_type & GO_IDLE) {
768 pool->ltp_pending_count++;
769 pool->ltp_active_count--;
770 if (pause && pool->ltp_active_count < 2) {
771 /* Tell the task waiting to DO_PAUSE it can proceed */
772 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal(&pool->ltp_pcond);
773 }
774 }
775
776 if (pause_type & GO_UNIDLE) {
777 /* Wait out pause if any, then cancel GO_IDLE */
778 if (pause > max_ltp_pause) {
779 ret = 1;
780 do {
781 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(&pool->ltp_cond, &pool->ltp_mutex);
782 } while (pool->ltp_pause > max_ltp_pause);
783 }
784 pool->ltp_pending_count--;
785 pool->ltp_active_count++;
786 }
787
788 if (pause_type & DO_PAUSE) {
789 /* Tell everyone else to pause or finish, then await that */
790 ret = 0;
791 assert(!pool->ltp_pause);
792 pool->ltp_pause = WANT_PAUSE;
793 /* Let ldap_pvt_thread_pool_submit() through to its ltp_pause test,
794 * and do not finish threads in ldap_pvt_thread_pool_wrapper() */
795 pool->ltp_open_count = -pool->ltp_open_count;
796 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
797 /* Hide pending tasks from ldap_pvt_thread_pool_wrapper() */
798 pool->ltp_work_list = &empty_pending_list;
799 /* Wait for this task to become the sole active task */
800 while (pool->ltp_active_count > 1) {
801 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(&pool->ltp_pcond, &pool->ltp_mutex);
802 }
803 assert(pool->ltp_pause == WANT_PAUSE);
804 pool->ltp_pause = PAUSED;
805 }
806
807 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
808 return(ret);
809}
810
811/* Consider this task idle: It will not block pool_pause() in other tasks. */
812void
813ldap_pvt_thread_pool_idle( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
814{
815 handle_pause(tpool, PAUSE_ARG(GO_IDLE));
816}
817
818/* Cancel pool_idle(). If the pool is paused, wait it out first. */
819void
820ldap_pvt_thread_pool_unidle( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
821{
822 handle_pause(tpool, PAUSE_ARG(GO_UNIDLE));
823}
824
825/*
826 * If a pause was requested, wait for it. If several threads
827 * are waiting to pause, let through one or more pauses.
828 * The calling task must be active, not idle.
829 * Return 1 if we waited, 0 if not, -1 at parameter error.
830 */
831int
832ldap_pvt_thread_pool_pausecheck( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
833{
834 return handle_pause(tpool, PAUSE_ARG(CHECK_PAUSE));
835}
836
837/*
838 * Pause the pool. The calling task must be active, not idle.
839 * Return when all other tasks are paused or idle.
840 */
841int
842ldap_pvt_thread_pool_pause( ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
843{
844 return handle_pause(tpool, PAUSE_ARG(DO_PAUSE));
845}
846
847/* End a pause */
848int
849ldap_pvt_thread_pool_resume (
850 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_t *tpool )
851{
852 struct ldap_int_thread_pool_s *pool;
853
854 if (tpool == NULL)
855 return(-1);
856
857 pool = *tpool;
858
859 if (pool == NULL)
860 return(0);
861
862 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
863
864 assert(pool->ltp_pause == PAUSED);
865 pool->ltp_pause = 0;
866 if (pool->ltp_open_count <= 0) /* true when paused, but be paranoid */
867 pool->ltp_open_count = -pool->ltp_open_count;
868 SET_VARY_OPEN_COUNT(pool);
869 pool->ltp_work_list = &pool->ltp_pending_list;
870
871 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_broadcast(&pool->ltp_cond);
872
873 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock(&pool->ltp_mutex);
874 return(0);
875}
876
877/*
878 * Get the key's data and optionally free function in the given context.
879 */
880int ldap_pvt_thread_pool_getkey(
881 void *xctx,
882 void *key,
883 void **data,
884 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_keyfree_t **kfree )
885{
886 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx = xctx;
887 int i;
888
889 if ( !ctx || !key || !data ) return EINVAL;
890
891 for ( i=0; i<MAXKEYS && ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key; i++ ) {
892 if ( ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key == key ) {
893 *data = ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_data;
894 if ( kfree ) *kfree = ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_free;
895 return 0;
896 }
897 }
898 return ENOENT;
899}
900
901static void
902clear_key_idx( ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx, int i )
903{
904 for ( ; i < MAXKEYS-1 && ctx->ltu_key[i+1].ltk_key; i++ )
905 ctx->ltu_key[i] = ctx->ltu_key[i+1];
906 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key = NULL;
907}
908
909/*
910 * Set or remove data for the key in the given context.
911 * key can be any unique pointer.
912 * kfree() is an optional function to free the data (but not the key):
913 * pool_context_reset() and pool_purgekey() call kfree(key, data),
914 * but pool_setkey() does not. For pool_setkey() it is the caller's
915 * responsibility to free any existing data with the same key.
916 * kfree() must not call functions taking a tpool argument.
917 */
918int ldap_pvt_thread_pool_setkey(
919 void *xctx,
920 void *key,
921 void *data,
922 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_keyfree_t *kfree,
923 void **olddatap,
924 ldap_pvt_thread_pool_keyfree_t **oldkfreep )
925{
926 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx = xctx;
927 int i, found;
928
929 if ( !ctx || !key ) return EINVAL;
930
931 for ( i=found=0; i<MAXKEYS; i++ ) {
932 if ( ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key == key ) {
933 found = 1;
934 break;
935 } else if ( !ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key ) {
936 break;
937 }
938 }
939
940 if ( olddatap ) {
941 if ( found ) {
942 *olddatap = ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_data;
943 } else {
944 *olddatap = NULL;
945 }
946 }
947
948 if ( oldkfreep ) {
949 if ( found ) {
950 *oldkfreep = ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_free;
951 } else {
952 *oldkfreep = 0;
953 }
954 }
955
956 if ( data || kfree ) {
957 if ( i>=MAXKEYS )
958 return ENOMEM;
959 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key = key;
960 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_data = data;
961 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_free = kfree;
962 } else if ( found ) {
963 clear_key_idx( ctx, i );
964 }
965
966 return 0;
967}
968
969/* Free all elements with this key, no matter which thread they're in.
970 * May only be called while the pool is paused.
971 */
972void ldap_pvt_thread_pool_purgekey( void *key )
973{
974 int i, j;
975 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx;
976
977 assert ( key != NULL );
978
979 for ( i=0; i<LDAP_MAXTHR; i++ ) {
980 ctx = thread_keys[i].ctx;
981 if ( ctx && ctx != DELETED_THREAD_CTX ) {
982 for ( j=0; j<MAXKEYS && ctx->ltu_key[j].ltk_key; j++ ) {
983 if ( ctx->ltu_key[j].ltk_key == key ) {
984 if (ctx->ltu_key[j].ltk_free)
985 ctx->ltu_key[j].ltk_free( ctx->ltu_key[j].ltk_key,
986 ctx->ltu_key[j].ltk_data );
987 clear_key_idx( ctx, j );
988 break;
989 }
990 }
991 }
992 }
993}
994
995/*
996 * Find the context of the current thread.
997 * This is necessary if the caller does not have access to the
998 * thread context handle (for example, a slapd plugin calling
999 * slapi_search_internal()). No doubt it is more efficient
1000 * for the application to keep track of the thread context
1001 * handles itself.
1002 */
1003void *ldap_pvt_thread_pool_context( )
1004{
1005 void *ctx = NULL;
1006
1007 ldap_pvt_thread_key_getdata( ldap_tpool_key, &ctx );
1008 return ctx ? ctx : (void *) &ldap_int_main_thrctx;
1009}
1010
1011/*
1012 * Free the context's keys.
1013 * Must not call functions taking a tpool argument (because this
1014 * thread already holds ltp_mutex when called from pool_wrapper()).
1015 */
1016void ldap_pvt_thread_pool_context_reset( void *vctx )
1017{
1018 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx = vctx;
1019 int i;
1020
1021 for ( i=MAXKEYS-1; i>=0; i--) {
1022 if ( !ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key )
1023 continue;
1024 if ( ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_free )
1025 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_free( ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key,
1026 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_data );
1027 ctx->ltu_key[i].ltk_key = NULL;
1028 }
1029}
1030
1031ldap_pvt_thread_t ldap_pvt_thread_pool_tid( void *vctx )
1032{
1033 ldap_int_thread_userctx_t *ctx = vctx;
1034
1035 return ctx->ltu_id;
1036}
1037#endif /* LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_TPOOL */
